title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.1 :EVIDENCE FOR SOCIAL POLICY

description.narrative: By end of 2018, evidence is generated and used to influence social budgeting and advocate for child-friendly sector budgets, social and economic policies and legislative measures, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end ot 2018, Policy analysis and knowledge produce high quality evidence for influencing child friendly policies, programmes laws and budget

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2018, evidence is generated and used to influence social budgeting and advocate for child-friendly sector budgets,social and economic policies and legislative measures

description.narrative: A partnership between the Ministry of Finance (MoF) and UNICEF contributed to strengthen capacity of 40 relevant officials and parliamentarians, generate evidence and conduct advocacy to influence social sector budget by strengthening public finance for children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
